intro: Flickingeria labangensis, commonly known as the Philippine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in forest understories and is known for its ornamental value. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
